alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 10 at 8:34AM PST until March 10 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWESTERN SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY... At 834 AM PST, local law enforcement reported dangerous flash flooding developing across the Warning area. Some roads are reported to be washed out, and the flooding situation is worsening. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen, with local amounts over 8 inches. Additional rainfall amounts of 4 to 8 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Debris flows consisting of rock and mud slides have been reported. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cambria, Point Piedras Blancas, Hearst Castle and Lake Nacimiento. This also includes the Highway 1 in northwest San Luis Obispo County. THIS IS BECOMING AN ESPECIALLY DANGEROUS FLOODING SITUATION, AND WILL CONTINUE TO WORSEN THROUGH THE DAY. Despite a brief break in the heavier rain in the next couple of hours, more heavy rain will move onshore causing the flooding to worsen. The Flash Flood Warning will likely be extended this afternoon. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
